I recently stayed at Hotel Ranbirs in Alambagh and opted for their Twin Bed Room. The location of the hotel is definitely one of its strongest points‚Äîespecially convenient for air travelers. The Lucknow airport is just a 10‚Äì15-minute drive away, making it a great choice for short stopovers or early morning flights. Additionally, there are a number of restaurants in the nearby area, which adds to the convenience. The hotel also has its own in-house restaurant, though I didn't get the chance to try it.

The Twin Bed Room I stayed in was very clean, which is always a plus. However, the room size was extremely compact‚ÄîI'd estimate it to be under 100 sq. ft. It felt quite cramped, especially for two people. So if you're planning to stay in a twin bed room, I'd suggest thinking it through, particularly if you need a bit more space to feel comfortable.

One major downside was the air conditioning. Despite setting it to 16 degrees Celsius, the room took over an hour to cool down, which was disappointing given the small size of the room. This could be a concern during the hotter months.

On the brighter side, the hotel overall seems well-maintained and offers a good standard of cleanliness. For solo travelers or short stays, especially for those catching flights, it can be a practical and budget-friendly choice. Just be mindful of the room size if you're booking a twin bed room.

In summary, Hotel Ranbirs offers a good location and cleanliness, but room size and AC performance in the twin bed category may leave you wanting more. It‚Äôs a decent place for a short stay, but consider your space needs before booking.

The staff was exceptionally cooperative, humble, and went above and beyond to ensure a pleasant experience.
Located near Shringarnagar Metro Station, the hotel is just 15 Minute ride from the airport, adding to its convenience. If you‚Äôre looking for a no-fuss, budget-friendly stay with great service, this is the place to be. Highly recommend!

Hey foodies! Today, I‚Äôm at Zaika Restaurant by Gemini Continental in Lucknow, and let me tell you, this place has the best buffet spread you could ever imagine! We're talking about over 60 dishes, and it‚Äôs not just a meal; it‚Äôs a whole experience!üòç

First off, the interiors here are absolutely stunning‚Äîluxury and royal vibes all around. You walk in and feel like you‚Äôre in a different world!ü´∂üèª

Now, let‚Äôs dive into the buffet. It kicks off with 6+ varieties of starters, both veg and non-veg. My top picks? The chicken tikka is to die for, the paneer spring rolls are crispy perfection, and you‚Äôve got to try the mutton galawati kebab‚Äîit‚Äôs served right at your table! Talk about service!üòá

And don‚Äôt miss the live counters! They‚Äôve got dosa, pasta, and waffles being made fresh just for you. How cool is that?ü§§

When it comes to the main course, you have more than 25 items to choose from! I‚Äôm talking about mutton korma, bhuna keema, kadhai paneer, dal makhni‚Äîseriously, it‚Äôs a feast! And if you‚Äôre in Lucknow, you can‚Äôt skip their awadhi biryani. Trust me; it‚Äôs a must-try!üòå

Now let‚Äôs chat about dessert. The options are endless! Whether you‚Äôre a chocolate lover or into traditional sweets, they‚Äôve got something for everyone.ü•µ

So if you're looking for an unforgettable buffet experience in Lucknow, Zaika Restaurant is where you need to be. Come hungry because this is not just a buffet; it‚Äôs an experience that will leave you wanting more!‚ù§Ô∏è

**Restaurant Review - ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê (3/5)**

I recently visited this restaurant for their buffet, and overall, it was an **okay-okay** experience. The variety was decent, but as a vegetarian, I was a bit disappointed with the starters. They were not as good as expected‚Äîsome lacked flavor, and a few felt a bit stale.

The main course was **better**, with a few good options, but nothing extraordinary. Desserts were **probably the best part**, offering a nice way to end the meal. The service was average, and the ambiance was decent.

If you‚Äôre looking for a **budget-friendly buffet**, it might be worth a try, but don't expect anything exceptional, especially for vegetarians.
